title: 115_hr3881
content: The Act titled "AFG and SAFER Program Reauthorization Act of 2017" reauthorizes the Assistance to Firefighters Grants Program and the Fire Prevention and Safety Grants Program. The Act reauthorizes the Assistance to Firefighters Grants Program and the Fire Prevention and Safety Grants Program. It includes provisions for specialized training to recognize and intervene with individuals with mental illness. Additionally, it reauthorizes the Staffing for Adequate Fire and Emergency Response Grant Program. The Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 is amended to repeal certain sections, modify application requirements, limitations, and waiver authority, and extend the authorization of appropriations until 2023. Additionally, the Act repeals the authority for certain use of grant amounts. The Act is amended to repeal certain sections, modify application requirements, limitations, and waiver authority, and extend the authorization of appropriations until 2023. It also repeals the authority for certain use of grant amounts and expands the Staffing For Adequate Fire and Emergency Response Grant Program. The Administrator of FEMA may develop an online training course for the fire and emergency response community on grant administration. Training will be tailored to their constraints and accessible to all members. SEC. 5 outlines the framework for oversight and monitoring of various grant programs related to firefighters and emergency response. The Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency will develop a grant monitoring framework to prevent fraud and abuse in grant programs for firefighters. This framework includes standardized guidance, risk assessments, site visits, and enforcement actions. The Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency will implement oversight and monitoring tools to prevent fraud, waste, abuse, and mismanagement in grant programs for firefighters.
